docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 7 (AP) -- Bud Browning, head coach of the American Olympic basketball team, today predicted his quintet would win the court crown in the eight-team elimination championship tournament which begins Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 7 (AP) -- Bud Browning, head coach of the American Olympic basketball team, today predicted his quintet would win the court crown in the eight-team elimination championship tournament which begins Monday.

headline.main: COACH OF U.S. FIVE PREDICTS TRIUMPH; Browning Sees Quintet Taking Title in Elimination Play Which Starts Tomorrow

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 8 -- The track and field Games of the XIV Olympiad, which closed yesterday before 83,000 spectators in Wembley Stadium, ran strikingly true to form. The United States, with ten first places in the men's division, five seconds and nine...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 8 -- The track and field Games of the XIV Olympiad, which closed yesterday before 83,000 spectators in Wembley Stadium, ran strikingly true to form. The United States, with ten first places in the men's division, five seconds and nine thirds, maintained the supremacy it has enjoyed since the modern revival of the Olympics in 1896, though it won two fewer championships than it had at Berlin in 1936.

headline.main: Olympic Track and Field True to Form With 10 American Triumphs; 8 REPEAT VICTORIES GAINED BY U.S. MEN Americans Missed in 4 of 12 Events They Took in 1936, but Annexed 2 Others GREAT INTEREST IN GAMES All Olympic Receipts Records Broken by Wembley Crowds of 60,000 to 83,000

byline.original: By ALLISON DANZIGSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HENLEY-ON-THAMES, England, Aug. 9 -- The glittering success of American athletes in track and field and in swimming and diving in the Games of the XIV Olympiad was extended today when the Golden Bears of the University of California won the...
docs.lead_paragraph: HENLEY-ON-THAMES, England, Aug. 9 -- The glittering success of American athletes in track and field and in swimming and diving in the Games of the XIV Olympiad was extended today when the Golden Bears of the University of California won the eight-oared championship, blue ribbon event of the rowing regatta on the Thames River.

headline.main: California Eight and Washington Four Annex Olympic Rowing Titles for U.S.; BEARS BEAT BRITISH BY THREE LENGTHS Third California Eight to Win Adds to String of American Successes Since 1920 U.S. FOUR WITH COX FIRST Washington Outrows Swiss -Wood of Australia Annexes Single Sculls at Henley

byline.original: By ALLISON DANZIGSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 9 -- The United States Olympic Basketball team entered the semi-final round here today by handing the Uruguayan combination a resounding defeat, 63 to 28.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 9 -- The United States Olympic Basketball team entered the semi-final round here today by handing the Uruguayan combination a resounding defeat, 63 to 28.

headline.main: U.S. QUINTET ROUTS URUGUAY BY 63-28; Mexico, France and Brazil Also Reach Semi-Final Round in Title Basketball

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WELLESSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: TORQUAY, England, Aug. 10 (AP) -- A flurry of protests marked the fifth day of the Olympic yacht races today as competitors from seventeen nations prepared for final encounters. Only two more days of racing remain for each of the five classes before...
docs.lead_paragraph: TORQUAY, England, Aug. 10 (AP) -- A flurry of protests marked the fifth day of the Olympic yacht races today as competitors from seventeen nations prepared for final encounters. Only two more days of racing remain for each of the five classes before total compilations are made to determine the champions.

headline.main: EVANS SHOWS WAY IN YACHTING RACE; Smarts Third With Hilarius in Star Class as Protests Mark Olympic Series

docs.snippet: WEMBLEY, England, Aug. 10 (AP) -- A full scale rhubarb shattered the austere calm of the Olympic boxing tournament today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WEMBLEY, England, Aug. 10 (AP) -- A full scale rhubarb shattered the austere calm of the Olympic boxing tournament today.

headline.main: Johnson, U.S., Scores in Ring As Fans Voice Strong Protests; Bedlam Lasts Nearly 20 Minutes After Close Featherweight Bout -- Sodano, Smith and Speizer, Americans, Win

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 11 (AP) -- The United States Olympic squad scored first places in weight-lifting and canoeing today to run its staggering point total to 573 -- a gain of forty-nine points during the day.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 11 (AP) -- The United States Olympic squad scored first places in weight-lifting and canoeing today to run its staggering point total to 573 -- a gain of forty-nine points during the day.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 11 -- Strong denunciation of the Argentine regime, which expelled an Oppositionist Deputy for having criticized President Juan Peron, has been sent to Ernesto Sammartino, Uruguayan Congress. A stenographic copy of the debate has...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 11 -- Strong denunciation of the Argentine regime, which expelled an Oppositionist Deputy for having criticized President Juan Peron, has been sent to Ernesto Sammartino, Uruguayan Congress. A stenographic copy of the debate has been sent to Ernesto San Martino, expelled deputy, it was learned today.
docs.abstract: Govt scores Argentine Parliament expulsion of Deputy San Martino for criticism of Pres Peron

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 12 (AP) -- The United States Olympic team, picking up points today in yachting and canoeing, pushed its total to 609 at the close of the twelfth day of competition. The Olympics will close on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 12 (AP) -- The United States Olympic team, picking up points today in yachting and canoeing, pushed its total to 609 at the close of the twelfth day of competition. The Olympics will close on Saturday.
